website_summaries.verdict: This laser printer comes with a higher price, but it offers duplex color printing at a reasonable speed.
pros: Replacement toner cartridges last for a long time
cons: Wireless setup can be tricky with a Mac
Some users turn off the deep sleep mode to get it to work

website_summaries.verdict: This no-nonsense color printer from Brother cuts extra features to keep the price down.
pros: This digital-LED printer is a low-cost color laser printer in all but name
Toner cartridges last a long time
cons: Despite being a single-function printer, it's big and heavy
Laser printers aren't great for color photos
Setup without a touchscreen is a pain

customer_reviews.title: Second one just died.  Fuser is not built to last.
customer_reviews.text: We've been through two now. Both died because the fuser rollers broke down and started killing print quality. This most recent one lasted from early 2016 to late 2017 - about a year and a half. The sad part is, when it works, this is a fine little printer. Until the printer jams (usually from trying to print duplex) and removing the jammed page tears the roller. Same thing happened both times. In the attached photos, the top roller should be entirely black, not showing orange udner the torn surface. IF THIS HAPPENS - NEVER REMOVE A JAMMED DUPLEX PRINT BY REMOVING THE TONER AND PULLING IT BACKWARDS - You are much more likely to ruin things this way.
customer_reviews.author: Peter Susi

customer_reviews.title: This worked good for 3300 prints
customer_reviews.text: This worked good for 3300 prints. Then began to disintegrate. Review video post as well. Here is my pic. If they replace the defective machine I will update my review. Really like this printer otherwise! Have had 5 brother printers. UPDATE - sent this pic to Brother Support with ticket. Emailed back that a Authorized repair guy would call. He did - told me a replacement roller assembly had been mailed - installed it a few days later. Works great. NO FUSS ON GETTING IT REPAIRED! Mine was out of warranty, but had low page count. Thank you Brother.
customer_reviews.author: G. Asturi

customer_reviews.title: Frustratingly complicated.
customer_reviews.text: This printer seems to ship with old drivers... Once online, it took hours to figure out why the printer disappears from our home network: When the machine goes to sleep, it really goes to sleep. Nowhere to be found....driver looses touch with the printer....until it gets turned off and on again. Once online, and after a good 10 minutes trying to figure out what the trouble shooting on the Brother website meant... I ended up in a Java script page with about a dozen and a 1/2 options. Not the usual automatic driver found, press download, download, install, done. Frustratingly complicated. It is 2017!
customer_reviews.author: Rafael A L

customer_reviews.title: Bad fuser roller
customer_reviews.text: Black fuse roller disintegrated after 3200 copies...Brother won't extend warranty unless all your toner cartridges are Brother originals. Fat chance of that! Leaves marks on paper...indentations.
customer_reviews.author: innovative

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't last long
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely loved this printer... until just after the year manufacturer warranty I received a "Print Unable" error which Brother tech support tells me is only fixable at my cost by one of their authorized service centers. Their closest center is 75 miles from me and from my research, the repair will likely cost more than I paid for the printer. Needless to say, I'm unfortunately shopping for a new printer and it won't be a Brother!!
customer_reviews.author: Andrea V.

customer_reviews.title: Happy to have color! I am a Brother fan!
customer_reviews.text: I have owned the black and white version of this printer for years. It has provided reliable service other than dual sided printing jams. This color version has not given me the same jam issues. The color is rich and it seems to integrate better than expected with my google chromebook. It is a bit slower to react when I hit print than my black and white. I am fairly ignorant to internet connectivity and that may explain the difference between the two. Otherwise, I am happy to finally have a color option and am glad that I took the plunge to buy this. I am hopeful of years of good service and have no indication otherwise at the moment.
customer_reviews.author: Ariel

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT BUY
customer_reviews.text: Terrible printer. Wireless connect will not stay connected. Even had an IT guy come try to get it work and it still failed an hour later. Brother customer service is a joke. No help. Now the machine is giving an error "Cover Open, Close Top Cover" and requires replacement of the sensor which runs about the same as a new machine... and of course it is out of warranty. It is going in the trash. I used to love Brother products but after my last two Brother printers - no more Brothers.
customer_reviews.author: skydive121

customer_reviews.title: Good printer with a problem
customer_reviews.text: I received this on time as usual. Printer was easy to setup and the wireless networking capability was really nice. Prints came out very clean and much faster than some other laser printers that I've used. I ended up returning it though because I utilize the single sheet feeder a lot and for whatever reason, this one just wouldn't take the sheet unless you placed a lot of pressure on the sheet you were trying to feed. Sometimes it would take the sheet and sometimes it would give a feed error. I don't know if this is typical with this printer or not but it was a deal breaker for me. Hope this was helpful!
customer_reviews.author: HiThere

customer_reviews.title: Great Printer
customer_reviews.text: This Brother HL-3170CDW Digital Color Printer is great. Don't much care for the "Waste Tank" shenanigans, but otherwise, it's a great color laser printer that delivers beautiful prints for basic situations. I wouldn't print photos with it, but it's nice for solid color type stuff. I am biased toward the Brother brand, having owned or used some of their other models throughout the years. Great quality. I like that I can plug a network cable into this thing and put it anywhere in the office/house and print to it on demand. It goes into sleep mode when not in use, which I love. I'd buy another if needed.
customer_reviews.author: A. Moore

customer_reviews.title: BUY THE WARRANTY!!  Not a reliable unit.
customer_reviews.text: I have purchased 3 of these for my office. Not 3 at one time, but to replace the broken one each time. It is a great printer when it works for the first 3-4-5-6 months, but when it finally craps the bed be prepared to pay a TON to fix it. Even if you fix it yourself, the drum/belt/developer/fuser easily cost more than the upfront cost of the printer, individually. Not to mention the cost of the OEM Brother toner, which is MORE than the printer. This time Im not playing... I bought the 3 year warranty. It wasnt expensive and I definitely plan on using it!!
customer_reviews.author: Technologic80

customer_reviews.title: Overall I am happy with this printer.
customer_reviews.text: We set this printer up at our office. We have to order replacement toner with two weeks we do print 15-20 pages a day, but I thought the starter toners would last a bit longer. Luckily I purposely ordered thiscprinter after reading lots of reviews and comparing options. One of those options was the ability to order 3rd party toner. Amazon has several third party toner options for this printer. Setup was really easy. Our studio is setup with different types of Apple iMacs and laptops. They all detected the printer and installed automatically.
customer_reviews.author: Danny H.

customer_reviews.title: 527 days and dead
customer_reviews.text: **edit** bumping up to three stars from 1. Left unplugged for a couple hours and plugged back in and worked. Hopefully this isn’t a recurring “feature”. 527 days since order and I'm in a no power situation. no clicks, no whirrs, no blinky lights. ran through troubleshooting and nothing, not even a whimper when plugging in ad nothing when pressing power button. sigh. I am all for suggestions as long as they don't involve testing on known good outlets and unplugging for 20 minutes and verifying correct power cord and making sure connections are snug. Because I've tried those.
customer_reviews.author: Sir tim-a-lot

customer_reviews.title: Quick Printer, Easy to Use
customer_reviews.text: Plugged in and prints with no issues. Synchronized to Windows 10 PC with no bother. Tried the auto-duplex and that works too. It's really quick printing color as all 4 toners run at once rather than my old printer which had to rotate toner cartridges one at a time. With all 4 toner colors lying parallel to each other its a little larger than a normal printer but not excessive. User interface is a little bare bones, I don't think this matters for day-to-day use but setting up the Wi-Fi password was a little tedious - pressing the up/down buttons to find the characters required - really hoping this is a one-off job.
customer_reviews.author: Dylan

customer_reviews.title: roller melted so each page printed comes up with the ...
customer_reviews.text: roller melted so each page printed comes up with the imprint of the melted roller. Printer only lasted 16 months.
customer_reviews.author: GS Eee

customer_reviews.title: Buy cheap & you get what you pay for. Too many errors & restarts.
customer_reviews.text: I wouldn't buy this printer ever. It really makes me not want to buy any brother printer ever again. It pauses randomly and than when you resume it starts all over again. The toner levels are inaccurate. The quality started to go down after about 5000 pages. I only print black and white with a tiny amount of color, but mostly B&W. It's a cheaply priced printer and you get what you pay for. Also the Brother brand toner is super pricey for a printer this price.
customer_reviews.author: Amazono Customer

customer_reviews.title: Colors are too intense and dark
customer_reviews.text: I've had this laser for over a year and have not been able to get the color intensity to not overpower the image. The color intensity is such that most photos are too dark and seldom, if ever approach the original. I've talked with Brother, searched the Internet, modified settings, etc. and the only (albeit unacceptable) solution is to print in draft mode where the colors aren't so dark. Don't get me wrong, the printer itself works great, cost per page is excellent, and text outstanding. It's just, IMHO, a poor laser to use for photo graphics.
customer_reviews.author: Ernest Pergrem

customer_reviews.title: Printer (via wifi) doesn't work reliabily
customer_reviews.text: SEE UPDATE BELOW - My IT guy from my company installed this printer in my home and said it was the most-difficult-to-set-up wifi printer he'd ever seen. I got it to print via wifi; but after 20 minutes, it went to sleep and wouldn't print again. I wasted a lot of time setting it up again. And sure enough it printed wirelessly ... only once. Then went to sleep and it wouldn't print again. I've given up and just bought a cord. Now that I've read the other negative reviews, I see it's a pattern others have experienced too. UPDATE: This printer doesn't print clearly and reliably. If you need professional printing, this might not be the best choice.
customer_reviews.author: Doing more webcasts

customer_reviews.title: Toners don't last long, poor quality on photos.
customer_reviews.text: This works great on printing color text. On detailed photos, colors don't come out true and they are definitely not crisp...almost kind of blury even on the best setting. Also, toners don't last long. I have printed 571 pages and it's now saying my black toner needs replaced. From the printed settings sheet, after 571 pages my black toner has about 8% life left, and the 3 colors have about 25% left. Looking at the cost of new toners which is almost $300 for all 4, I don't know about spending that much on this thing since the print quality sucks. I guess that's what I get from buying one of the cheapest ones I could find.
customer_reviews.author: Ben

customer_reviews.title: Beast Mode!
customer_reviews.text: Have had this 5 months. Instead of buying expensive ink from Amazon, I took a tip from another reviewer here and bought it from suppliesguys... and with the money I saved on that, purchased the 4 year warranty. This printer is a beast. By far the best economy laser printer I've ever used. Can handle long jobs and color looks great. Didn't have issues setting up wifi - instead of using the included disk, I went to the Brother website and downloaded the software/driver bundle. I didn't have to touch the printer to set up wifi, the software install handles that from the pc. iPhones recognized it no problem. So far so good.
customer_reviews.author: CW

customer_reviews.title: Easy and Quick to Set Up. Good Looking Output
customer_reviews.text: This printer was easy to set up but involved a number of steps to remove the packing material and tape. Be sure to follow all the steps before plugging the printer in. Connecting to my router was easy and fast. From unpacking to printing was 15 minutes or so. Be sure to check the dimensions of the space you plan to put the printer and compare it to the printer dimensions. It is a bit wide and deep and requires some space around the printer itself to dissipate heat. I've only printed a few pages so far and all look good.
customer_reviews.author: Richard A. Birdsall

customer_reviews.title: Didn't last 6 months.
customer_reviews.text: Saved up for a laser copier. Worked fine for 5 months, then I got a new modem and couldn't get it back working. 8 different friends tried to get it to work, also 2 people at Brother support and 2 people from Apple. The problem was not my internet or my computer. The printer just stopped being able to respond to my computer. Brought out my 7 year old HP Envy and had it up and working in 30 seconds. Now I have many people telling me their horror stories about their Brother copiers with the exact same problem. Go buy a different brand of printer.
customer_reviews.author: spike

customer_reviews.title: Comes with fake toner cartridges
customer_reviews.text: When I unpacked the printer, I was pleasantly surprised to discover toner cartridges were already installed. The printer immediately started producing wonderful color copies, but after a few copies, the black toner ran out. The new cartridge I bought from a stationery store cost almost $50.00, which seemed very expensive, considering the few copies it produced. I discovered the product code for the preinstalled cartridge was slightly different from the one I bought at the store. Apparently, special almost-empty cartridges are preinstalled at the factory. After purchasing all new toner cartridges, my new printer works great. The empty-cartridge feature should be explained somewhere.
customer_reviews.author: Frank

customer_reviews.title: Jagged Edges
customer_reviews.text: If this machine didn't have such a good print speed and wifi connection, I'd give them one star. It prints quickly but the problem I had was it printed straight lines with jagged edges. Someone else already uploaded a picture of this in an earlier review. I figured it was just a setting he missed. I called Brother tech support and they were less than helpful. Before even placing that call, I did my own troubleshooting but no luck. If you most print small/standard text, this is a good choice machine. If you have to print any type of graphics, those jagged lines may cause you a few headaches!
customer_reviews.author: Prime Purchaser

customer_reviews.title: you get what you pay for
customer_reviews.text: fuser/printer broke in less than 5 months and amazon would not let me return it. i contacted brother directly and was advised they knew of the problem and there's an extended warranty. they would replace the unit and offered to send someone to look at the printer. they advised that after a year, there was no more warranty and it would be out of my own pocket for repairs. i've used so many brand printers in the past and it's my first brother. bad experience and will never buy another. rather spend a little more and have a long lasting printer. i spent 2 hours on customer service.
customer_reviews.author: F

customer_reviews.title: Great printer, easy set up
customer_reviews.text: Great quality, speed. Quick set up. I saw some people complained about deep sleep. The worst case is you walk over and press a button on the printer and it will start printing. I have printed about 200 pages with the cheapest paper at Walmart and have not had a jam yet. I normally don't like buying big ticket items with less than 4 stars but honestly this is a great buy. I think some people expect a $1500 office printer. This is simply perfect for home or small office use.
customer_reviews.author: Pete

customer_reviews.title: Had High Hopes
customer_reviews.text: I had really high hopes for this printer, and maybe my expectations were too high. I had heard such great things about this printer and was excited to use it a lot, but I was honestly pretty disappointed. Positives: I love that it works with wifi and I don't have to attach my computer to it, and it is also able to easily print front to back. It does well when printing b&w Negatives: the pictures are not crisp. I can't think of the words to describe the picture quality, but it is almost like a newspaper, where it's kind of blurry and not completely solid color.
customer_reviews.author: R Weber

customer_reviews.title: Awesome!!!
customer_reviews.text: I bought the Brother B&W laser printer several years ago and I love it. Absolute work horse. Great print and inexpensive toner. I tell everyone looking for a B&W printer to buy one. Tired of buying cartridges for a color inkjet printer. I looked at this Brother color printer. I've only had it for a short time but, I would highly recommend this printer. Comparatively, very inexpensive. Toner is cheap (way cheap compared to ink jet cartridges). Easy to setup. Easy to network (I can even print from my phone) and great print quality. Time will tell how durable it is but if its anything like the B&W printer it will last for years and years.
customer_reviews.author: Charles D

customer_reviews.title: STAY AWAY FROM THIS ONE.  UGH.
customer_reviews.text: Oh how I wish someone had been honest and warned me about this printer!! Less than 6 months and I am ready to toss it in the river! It is impossible. It works when it's cold, but after printing a few sheets all it does is jam or say the cartridges need to be removed and replaced, over and over and over!! I CANNOT GET ANY WORK DONE!!! I HATE THIS THING and am now having to buy another new printer and believe me it WON'T BE A BROTHER! I'll go back to HP unless someone has an honest recommendation for a color laser printer that actually works!
customer_reviews.author: 0591courseydr

customer_reviews.title: so far so good
customer_reviews.text: haven't had it long, so far i am loving it. setup was a breeze. love the hydraulic lid. color quality impressed me. ive read other reviews and it seems brother has fixed its roller issues.... we shall see... added two photos. one downloaded the other a print of that download. color accuracy was near identical. the photo i took was low light so not as crisp but it did indeed look good.
customer_reviews.author: Nicholas R

customer_reviews.title: great product but it lies and tells you that you are out of toner when you are not
customer_reviews.text: great product but it lies and tells you that you are out of toner when you are not; it's a scam by Brother to make you buy toner; research on the internet how to override the lockout that it puts you in when it claims, falsely, that you are out of ink; deceive the machine into thinking you have changed cartridges, and you will print for a long time past when the machine lied to you and told you you were out of ink
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great price and value for your money !
customer_reviews.text: This was easy to setup, quick setup guide. little to big for my liking but i am not returning it. as you pay for inkjet printers more them $200 per year on average for ink. I suggest you to by Color Laser printer. it will save you money in the long run. HP, EPSON and other brands are playing you for ink and robbing your money. Don't by branded any more. Try Brother unit is really efficient and really great. I love it. Print out are great will save money for me than wasting on ink jet printers. Easy installation Easy setup Easy handling on prints Always connected and ready to print on Wifi
customer_reviews.author: Mindika Dharmabandu

customer_reviews.title: Shortly after I set up the printer, I printed ...
customer_reviews.text: Shortly after I set up the printer, I printed five copies of two booklets. Everything went very smoothly. The quality looked really professional. I printed a photograph, but it lacked the vibrance that I expected. I then checked the settings and realized that there are options which might had corrected this issue. So I made the adjustments and then printed more photographs and every one was beyond my expectations. For a small office or home, this is an ideal printer.
customer_reviews.author: Fr Dn Michael Bishop

customer_reviews.title: Fast printer. Fuser roll broke due to design defect. poor color saturation, bleak blacks.
customer_reviews.text: A really fast printer, however the quality of print outs is not that great, and the black fuser roll behind the back panel somehow got damaged. It wrinkles paper and leaves stains on the print outs. Apparently there are multiple complains about vulnerability and design flaw that leads to defects of the fuser roll. It’s disappointing that the Brother doesn’t stand behind the quality of their product. Today we went and bought a new HP printer, even though we thought that a new brother model had a better functionality and more economical cartridges, but we just don’t want another poorly designed malfunctioning product.
customer_reviews.author: NewYork Mom

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT PURCHASE!!!
customer_reviews.text: This printer is awful!!! Was looking to upgrade last year; after some research I decided on this particular model. I have regretted ever since. The black barely prints any pages before it says the cartridge is empty. Once you replace it, the sensor doesn’t register or something therefore thinks the cartridge is still empty. Finally figured that issue out, but since then it has never printed right. Everything prints is light black ink if at all. This was not a cheap printer and up until now I thought Brother was a good brand-boy was I wrong. Please DO NOT waste your money!!!
customer_reviews.author: John and Rachel Hensley

customer_reviews.title: Deep sleep?  Try a Coma - won't wake up on it's own!
customer_reviews.text: Deep Sleep? Try a Coma. This printer when it's awake (about 2 minutes at a time) works great however the machine goes to sleep and won't wake up until you power down and then power back on. I've read the manual, changed the settings but to no avail. I've been trying to figure it out for the past 60 days but haven't been able to get it to work right. Now I see my return window is closed. So...once again stuck with a couple hundred dollar paperweight. I wish someone would make a printer that just worked! Maybe I got a lemon but I would not recommend wasting your money or time on this one.
customer_reviews.author: Doug

customer_reviews.title: Horrible Unit with Multiple Issues
customer_reviews.text: This thing has been a disaster. I'm bought one that ended up having a problem with terrible print quality. I bought new cartridges and drum and it still failed. Since I had all this brand new toner I bought a second one since the first was out of warranty. Now that the black toner ran out the replacement toner and a second brand new toner both show as worn our even though they are genuine brother cartridges and brand new.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin Purcell

customer_reviews.title: Best printer we’ve owned
customer_reviews.text: We have had this printer since 2016 and the only issue we have is the double sided printing quit working. We haven’t invested any time in figuring out why so it could be simple. We continue printing even when it says toner is low with no fade at all. We’ve only replaced cartridges twice and I’m constantly printing for crafts and work.
customer_reviews.author: Armaddon

customer_reviews.title: Terrible printer
customer_reviews.text: Hate this printer with a passion. I used it for a few days and it just wouldn't work! Setting it up was annoying and in general I have never struggled with a printer in my life this makes it very difficult for your daily tasks. The deep sleep mode is terrible it defeats the purpose of having a wireless printer. Also drops connection with my laptop making the situation even more frustrating. I would not recommend it more work than what it is worth.
customer_reviews.author: MAA

customer_reviews.title: So disappointed.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this printer because it has the ability to print wirelessly. We also have one that only prints black at work and it has been a good printer. I am VERY disappointed - I have tried for 3 weeks to get it to sync with my MacBook Pro to no avail. I have wasted so many hours loading, unloading and then reloading drivers etc. If I can't get it to sync to my computer in the next few days I will be returning it!
customer_reviews.author: Grammy

customer_reviews.title: Prints great but new name brand toner is almost as much as the printer it self!
customer_reviews.text: Bought this printer in April 2018. I homeschool so I print a lot! The original toner printed beautifully and lasted until the end of the summer so we purchased an off brand toner and it prints like crap! I wish I would have gotten the EcoTank where they do not rake you over the coals for ink! Very disappointed in Brother. Never buying another Brother printer again. Update: the manual feeder has stopped working.. so I can no longer print things on heavy card stock paper- only regular copy paper. Boo.
customer_reviews.author: Sean Smith

customer_reviews.title: Great printer, works with Ubuntu
customer_reviews.text: I bought this printer for home use after being disgusted with the short life and tradeoffs (expensive supplies or inferior printing) of a few different inkjets. Setup was easy, print quality is great, and while it is obviously a bit noisy being a laser printer, I have no complaints. Sure, the duplexing could be a bit faster, but this isn't a floor printer, so small compromises are inevitable. FYI, I set this up with my home PC using Ubuntu 16.04 LTS over wireless. While Ubuntu didn't have a PDS file for this model, I used one from a Brother printer with similar features (a different CDW model) and have had zero issues.
customer_reviews.author: GeorgeOlfraidi

customer_reviews.title: I've had more trouble than good with this printer
customer_reviews.text: Unfortunately, I've had more trouble than good with this printer. We have used it a handful of times successfully, and in the last few weeks it finally worked ok but has now stopped completely and is requiring we send it in and get it serviced. It's about a month passed the 1 year warranty, so servicing is not covered. With as little as we use it, there just shouldn't be a need for servicing unless it was built poorly, or not new when we purchased it. I just can't recommend it, personally.
customer_reviews.author: Rae

customer_reviews.title: Decent printer, but do not buy if you require double-sided printing
customer_reviews.text: I do like this printer, and I would have given it five stars except for the fact that the double-sided printing feature does not work and has never worked and that was one of the main reasons why i purchased it. I decided to keep it because it still prints well, but overall i am disappointed that Brother would make a machine and advertise it with an automatic double-sided printing feature, probably knowing full well that when you try to print double sided it jams EVERY SINGLE TIME.
customer_reviews.author: ABeautifulLife

customer_reviews.title: Worst Printer Ever!
customer_reviews.text: If you like printing only 1 page at a time so the ink actually prints on the page AND have to be connected via USB, you should buy this printer. I spend more time trying to fix this thing than actually printing. I Print what I need at work now because I can not count on printing on this piece of crap. On the phone with support now. My year is almost up so I am trying to get another (i.e., DIFFERENT) printer. I will not accept this one again.
customer_reviews.author: dawnslp

customer_reviews.title: Excellent print quality, not great features.
customer_reviews.text: I've had this for over a year in my home office, I print LOTS of color handouts for presentations. Print quality is excellent, and prints quickly if doing one-sided standard size paper - if this is all I was doing I would love this printer. But 2-sided printing is very slow, and envelope printing is painful. Envelopes must be manually fed one at a time, and it jams constantly (every other one). And after printing 3 or 4 envelopes it needs to cool down - I needed to print a couple hundred envelopes, it was horrific. But again, printing regular paper is fast and looks great.
customer_reviews.author: BKitty

customer_reviews.title: Poor quality color prints
customer_reviews.text: This is my first review. I felt compelled to add my opinion after using the Brother HL-3170CDW. I currently have Brother monochrome printer that is a work horse! No problems with it after rigorous use. That led me to the purchase of a Brother color printer. Big disappointment!!! The color prints, regardless of source, were grainy and the color is off. I spent 53 minutes on the phone with Brother support and the representative, patient as he was, could not do anything to improve the quality of the color prints. Thankfully, Amazon is letting me return the printer.
customer_reviews.author: GGH

customer_reviews.title: Broke after 1.5 yrs
customer_reviews.text: Printer printed well. We had it networked and it would constantly go into deep sleep mode with the only way to wake it up being unplug in and plug back in. After 1.5 yrs of ownership we received a constant drum full error. Brother support said it was broken, out of warranty, and told us where to take it to get repaired. The repair costs more than a new printer. Do not recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Happy
customer_reviews.text: I'm already happy I bought this printer. The only drawback I see is the printer's footprint. Other than that I'm super happy with performance and how well the included documentation walked me through some frustration I was having setting up wifi printing, frustrations that were entirely based on the age of my tech. I'd recommend this printer to others.
customer_reviews.author: Mike Scantlin

customer_reviews.title: So far so good! Very easy to setup across all of the ...
customer_reviews.text: So far so good! Very easy to setup across all of the family computers and phones- finally a printer that is actually easy to set up! Wireless is handy- was able to place it in a more convenient location. Print quality seems very good for basic work in black and white or color. Resolution noticeably sharper than the HP it replaced. 3 month update... Still running well, and printing great. No issues, no jams, always working. My black toner "ran out" after 521 pages though and wouldn't print. Did the reset trick mentioned in questions section and worked great. Printing again
customer_reviews.author: Stuart Leslie

customer_reviews.title: Fabulous deal for a great price
customer_reviews.text: Can I just say wow? We've used this a number of times since we've gotten it, and I am still astonished by the excellent quality of prints and vibrant colors. The built-in duplexer (which allows you to print on both sides without manually flipping the paper) is a huge plus as well. Took about three minutes to do the wireless setup. The fact that we were able to get a printer of this quality for such a low price still blows me away.
customer_reviews.author: CeCe Garrett

customer_reviews.title: Dumped my HP Officejet for this!
customer_reviews.text: Already have the monochrome version of this and it's been great, so decided to get the color version. It's s GREAT! I almost wet my pants! High expectations I have! Found on youtube how to refill toner as this has been around a long time, with good reviews. Bought it for a specific 'job/requirement'. I have an HP Officejet printer that the toner cost more than this entire laser printer WITH toner. I'm finished being ripped off by HP inkjets that 'fail' in some way destroying the entire printer.
customer_reviews.author: Mike S.

customer_reviews.title: Terrible printing and doesn't last
customer_reviews.text: Bought this in late 2015. Within 1.5 years the fuser roller broke and created smudges on all prints. Had so much trouble trying to replace the fuser that hubby nearly cracked the entire printer. 6 months later, the newer fuser is still on the fritz. Color printings was iffy to begin with. Didn't print super clearly. Overall I like Brother printers but was very disappointed with this one and now I need to get another printer.
customer_reviews.author: W. Cusick

customer_reviews.title: Great price and quality!
customer_reviews.text: SUPER easy to set up! Windows 10 sees it right away and pulls the drivers. Wireless setup is easy to navigate in the menus. Can print from iPad, Android and Iphone and PC's. Have only had for a week, but it has printed everything we have thrown at it with no issues or errors. It does have a rather large footprint so make sure that you have the needed room on your desk!
customer_reviews.author: RedRebelChick

customer_reviews.title: Manufacturing Defect. Avoid
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this printer March 2015. It worked well for about a year or so but then it appears to have a manufacturing defect in that the fuser outer materials peels off (probably due to heat) and then ruins the paper. Paper comes out with junk all over it and with creases. the burned out plastic also melts off creating a potential safety issue
customer_reviews.author: slh22

customer_reviews.title: Gets the job done. Claims it runs out of toner before it actually does (which you can get around)
customer_reviews.text: Pretty good printer. Please don't change the toners when they claim to run out though. The printer doesn't measure the ink level based on what's actually left, just based on page count (i.e. the number of pages printed while using that toner.) It's highly conservative and tells you it runs out way before it actually does. I've reset the page count via the key pad twice so far and the ink is still printing strong. (To do the same, just Google it with this printer and the answer should pop up in the first few links.) As usual, laser jets aren't amazing for printing pictures, but this one does a decent job.
customer_reviews.author: Pen Name

customer_reviews.title: USB connector broke after 3 months.
customer_reviews.text: USB broke after 3 months, amazon won't let me return the product due to 1 month return policy. Power surges any connected USB. Thankfully my computer's USBs are durable and didn't break but the USB of this brother printer does more damage than good. edit: years later, every method of connecting to my computer is broken, I don't know why I keep this piece of junk when I've only used it a few times. I've truly never had such terrible customer service from a company as reputable as this one.
customer_reviews.author: MrPat

customer_reviews.title: Don't  Waste your money ...
customer_reviews.text: This Printer is the biggest pile of crap, do not waste your money. Not only does it falsely say it is out of toner, when there is plenty of toner left,requiring a special reset (open the lid hold 2 buttons for 5 seconds), it also likes to randomly go to sleep and looses pages in the spooler, and is really really slow, sometimes taking up to 5 minuets after you hit print to spit out a page. This thing need hit with a sledgehammer, period.
customer_reviews.author: Jens A. Butler

customer_reviews.title: Good value printer for color duplex printing
customer_reviews.text: Arrived in great time. Once it was in my home office, it was relatively easy to install on a Mac with High Sierra (no disc drive needed). About the only thing I don't like about the printer is the menu (not as intuitive), and printing from Adobe Acrobat DC is VERY slow. I'm not sure if the issue is with the printer (word documents print quickly) or Acrobat (which sometimes wouldn't print at all on a Lexmark, hence my trepidation about the software and not the printer).
customer_reviews.author: William LAmoreaux

customer_reviews.title: 1 Year and Done; Unreliable Printer, Courteous but Ineffective Tech Support
customer_reviews.text: Had this printer for 1 year before the intermittent "offline" went to permanently "offline" even with a direct USB connection - Wireless connectivity stopped functioning after just a few months - blamed on my "rolling IP address" according to Tech Support. Brother Tech Support works M-F 9-5; so if your printer malfunctions outside this window, you will have no tech support. Tech Support answers troubleshoots by reading their manual - I also read the manual and could not fix, didn't need tech support to read it back to me......Polite dudes but not very effective at fixing especially as the time of day gets closer to 5PM. Also, cannot print on card stock...too many negatives, for this printer, buy something else.
customer_reviews.author: Todd J Gelb

customer_reviews.title: No duplex (2-sided) printing in google cloud print
customer_reviews.text: One star because this issue almost made me return this printer: While it can do duplex printing (test run of 10 sheets/20pages black and white, printing from local Windows 10, took 2min and 54sec, however), this menu item is unavailable when printing via google cloud. However, since I only do duplex printing in order to help the environment, what good is it to return an otherwise working printer (with Amazon or Brother possible throwing it in the trash)? This issue could be taken care off with a simple firmware fix, so this one star review is justified for laziness of brother's engineers.
customer_reviews.author: Dietmar

customer_reviews.title: Poor quality prints and no support from Amazon after only two months!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this printer in August and it worked well at first. After two months of using it, changing out all the toner cartridges, cleaning it according to the directions, and only 2700 pages printed; it is performing very poorly. The printer was purchased through Amazon.com and when I tried to get support from Amazon I received the message that the support window had closed for this item. It’s only been two months!
customer_reviews.author: Spoozle

customer_reviews.title: Quality printer; Google Cloud Print can be frustrating.
customer_reviews.text: I'm very pleased with the print quality of this printer. It was easy to setup and configure. My only complaint is with the built-in Google Cloud Print capabilities. It regularly (monthly) de-registers from my google account and I have to go through the registration process again to set it up for my phone and other devices. Supposedly the latest firmware fixed this issue. I installed the new firmware to my printer a few weeks ago and haven't had a problem yet. I will update my review if it continues to be a problem.
customer_reviews.author: MJP

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use and excellent results
customer_reviews.text: This is my third Brother printer, and I think I'm a fan. This machine replaces the two that I had a few decades back, a Tectronix Phaser 560 and a Minolta Color Pageworks, both worth many thousands new and requiring about $1200 of toner, and I dare say that not only is it more sophisticated yet easier to use, but it does an excellent job with a variety of papers. I love that it has a straight-through feed for heavy paper and that it does automatic duplexing. Oh, and for dinosaurs like me who stubbornly refuse to join the twenty-onest century, it works fine on Windows XP.
customer_reviews.author: Herb Lueck

customer_reviews.title: Works smoothly with macOS and iOS
customer_reviews.text: My family's been using this for months, and we're quite pleased. I bought it because I was tired of our inkjet printers constantly drying out and/or running out of ink (invariably when we really needed to print). This laser printer wakes up when we send it a print job; the printer warms up and prints quickly. The pages come out crisp and clean. It's not "photo quality" for scrapbooks, but is great for business, home, and school documents. We print wirelessly to it all the time and find it works well for us.
customer_reviews.author: smittyfodder

customer_reviews.title: Would highly recommend.
customer_reviews.text: Love this printer, pretty fast, very crisp, lovely text, love having color (I've had a b&w laser printer for 10 years which finally died on me) and love having the duplex and AirPrint options. Really happy with this purchase and the price was really reasonable compared to a color laser.
customer_reviews.author: Renee

customer_reviews.title: Absolute crap. Paper jam indicator keeps popping on when there ...
customer_reviews.text: Absolute crap. Paper jam indicator keeps popping on when there is no jam. Printer falls 'asleep' and wont wake up to print unless you turn off and on again. Many reports of this issue online. Incredible that a printer has one thing in the world to do and yet this company builds a printer that won't print.
customer_reviews.author: dstar081095

customer_reviews.title: PIECE OF JUNK.
customer_reviews.text: Six months in, and i'm done. Brother's gone downhill. Uses toner like crazy. Low-toner stops the machine from printing. Couldn't override. Paper-feed miscues, and the machine often thinks it's out of paper. I've used/liked Brother toner printers for 10 years. No more. They USED to have good customer service. No more. Maybe this was a lemon, but I'm not wasting any more time/money on them.
customer_reviews.author: LoLi from Texas

customer_reviews.title: A work horse. If you have an older model ...
customer_reviews.text: A work horse. If you have an older model be sure to update your firmware. Brother has altered the heat cycle to deal with the problem of disintegrating rollers. Our fuser roller self-destructed after three years, but Brother paid for replacement of the fuser assembly and all labor. I went to the Brother Solution Center to find a local repair company and they were top-notch, responsive and quick. I would buy this printer again in an instant. I have a monochrome Brother printer which is also a winner.
customer_reviews.author: Tom DeMarco

customer_reviews.title: Do not buy this printer
customer_reviews.text: I bought June of 2016, and the printer works fine when I am able to print. I have this printer set up on the wireless network. To be able to get the printer to work I have to go through the entire wireless network wizard setup process every time I want to print. This means I waste several minutes and at least one piece of paper to set up the printer. I have called brother support to get help trouble shooting this issue and the very next time that I went to print I had to go through the entire printer set up process. It is just wastes a lot of time and paper.
customer_reviews.author: Dan Ross

customer_reviews.title: Worked flawlessly for 16 months now
customer_reviews.text: Great printer! Had no problems setting it up or getting it to work on my home network. I've had it for 16 months now (as of 11/15/2018) and I have had zero problems! I just got the message that the toner is running low, so it's time to replace, but considering how much printing I've done, I think it was a great deal.
customer_reviews.author: Kody Miles

customer_reviews.title: Very happy with purchase.
customer_reviews.text: I was getting tired of filling my wife's ink jet cartridges at the local cartridge place while my ten year old Samsung multi laser printer just used toner that lasted for a long time. Ink jets are always clogging or something seems to go wrong. I thought I would get a newer color laser that could be connected to the home network and print off of all devices. This unit is a gem! I have a gigabyte home network, plugged it in, set it up and haven't looked back. As they state in their specs it is not good for pictures but great on everything else. Super happy with this purchase, quality and price. Amazon Prime shipping is always awesome.
customer_reviews.author: David M. Hoffman

customer_reviews.title: Printer works great. A few things to note
customer_reviews.text: Printer works great. A few things to note: Easy set up. When setting up for wireless, you do have to use the USB cable to connect your printer to your device (a laptop, etc.) but pick setting up wireless as the option. Afterwards you will be set up as wireless and can remove the cable. The cartridges that it comes with don't last long but the replacements do. I have so far printed 500 pages and they look great and print so fast. So much better than my inkjet compared to quality and speed!. Even though the replacement cartridges are expensive, they last long as it's worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: D Yanow

customer_reviews.title: The Brother HL-3170CDW Digital Color Printer is perhaps the best low-priced color laser printer!
customer_reviews.text: So far, so good! Originally purchased a factory refurbished HP M451DN Laserjet Enterprise 400 Color Printer- which was essentially D.O.A. (Dead on arrival), as it continually gave the error message "paper jam in tray 1", despite there being no paper in tray 1! This is a known problem with that model HP printer which is NOT easily resolved by software or firmware, and thus the unit had to returned for a full refund... so, stay away from that printer! On the other hand, the Brother HL-3170CDW Digital Color Printer was very easy to set up and prints beautifully and with ease. I highly recommend this printer to anyone who is looking for a low-priced color laser printer.
customer_reviews.author: Ronald A. Marshall

customer_reviews.title: This Thing Is A Work Horse!
customer_reviews.text: This is my 2nd one in 4.5 years! I printed over 16,000 pages, including lots of cardstock, before it started needing new parts - mainly a new drum for the Yellow. None of the other drums complained. It also started to leave an indent across the paper from something. Never found what was causing it. When I priced parts to update it, it was just cheaper to buy a new one!
customer_reviews.author: Shana

customer_reviews.title: worth every penny
customer_reviews.text: okay, first off this thing works awesome. i am currently using it to print packing slips for amazon orders because i was killing an ink jet cartridge in 2 weeks. the colors are nice and vivid, i would recommend buying a usb printer cable for the installation though, it will make the wireless setup a whole lot easier. i think the people complaining about the technical problems are blaming the machine instead of themselves. if you don't know how to use a computer or simple networking, just don't buy it. its that simple. setting up a printer is pretty simple.
customer_reviews.author: chris

customer_reviews.title: Dull printing
customer_reviews.text: I love Brother products and I've used their Laser printers for more than 10 years.... BUT, this color printer - although it looks as sturdy as any other Brother product - the quality and crispness of the images are not good (faint contrast, some even with streaks like in the attached image)
customer_reviews.author: Random

customer_reviews.title: It IS heavy, it's my Brother!
customer_reviews.text: So far I am very happy with this LED-based, laser-class color printer. It is more compact than the Brother color laser I had before, offers good images, and has the flawless paper handling I so appreciate in Brother printers. It replaces two laser printers I just took off-line, a monochrome and a color, and duplexes faster. No, it isn't a walk-up fax or copier, but so long as you have a multi-function or a scanner nearby, you can accomplish those operations easily. Lifting should have had two people, as the directions showed. Otherwise setup was very easy. Windows 10 loaded the latest drivers automatically.
customer_reviews.author: Martha Knight

customer_reviews.title: It's kind of a beast!
customer_reviews.text: This is no diminutive, portable mini printer. Built like a tank, 4 full size toner cartridges. It set up extremely quickly and easily. Took less than 10 minutes to unpack, set up wireless printing, and connected with my Imac. Print quality is great for documents, graphs, reports, banners, etc. I wouldn't recommend (or does Brother) for quality photo printing, but it will work in a pinch and looks decent enough, especially when you use a heavy paper stock. Overall, I'm very impressed with this machine at this price point. It looks, weighs and performs like a $600 machine
customer_reviews.author: P. Zimmerman

customer_reviews.title: This one is a great buy
customer_reviews.text: Love it! Never had a color laser printer before, just ink jets, and this color laser works great! Wireless too! Remote printing from my smartphone. It's got it all! I am now a big fan of Brother laser printers. I also have a MFC-L2740DW and it does the same thing, just in monochrome and also faxes and scans flawlessly. Both are worth every penny!
customer_reviews.author: Retired 911 Guy

customer_reviews.title: you can't find a better color laser printer
customer_reviews.text: For the price, you can't find a better color laser printer. It has a lot of connectivity features, which is very handy. The color rendition is good, the eyeballed DPI is ok,but not excellent. I would highly recommend this for home or small business users. I docked 1 star because it is a very slow printer (long delay between pages). I often walk over to the printer expecting it to be done (printing 1-3 pages at a time), and end up waiting for what seems like a painfully long time. It handles card stock well from either the bottom tray or the manual feeder.
customer_reviews.author: WS

customer_reviews.title: Easy setup, good documentation, excellent experience
customer_reviews.text: Received printer today (box and contents in excellent condition). Setup went smoothly. I am using a wired ethernet network with static IP addresses, windows XP32 machines and windows7-64 machines. Laptops connect to my network via wifi, and then print through the network. Also used the online registration. Whole process only took a couple of hours, including disconnecting and moving my old printer.
customer_reviews.author: willie

customer_reviews.title: Poor Manual Printing
customer_reviews.text: Does a good job at standard printing, both single and double sided printing. although a little slow on the double sided printing. My biggest problem with this printer is the "Manual" printing. I use several sizes of paper and envelopes and when I use the Manual printing I constantly get a paper jam warning. It has gotten worse. I was able to get some printing done after several paper jam warnings FOR EACH PAGE. Today I tried to print 10 envelopes and after 8 paper jam warnings on the first envelope I decided use a different printer, OKI. The Brother printer is my default printer because of the double side printing. I may have to change that.
customer_reviews.author: Michael H.

customer_reviews.title: Much satisfied
customer_reviews.text: Well packaged, received without damage. Good instructions for initial unpacking and setup, however, a call to customer service was needed for a wired connection to my Mac. Took only a few minutes to align my System Preferences correctly. Customer service rep was kind and very helpful. Prints as good as any expensive commercial printer at the office. Reasonably priced, substantial construction. More later after a few months use. I don't think you will be disappointed with this purchase. Glad I chose this Brother.
customer_reviews.author: John M

customer_reviews.title: It has been a great printer. The fan is a little louder than ...
customer_reviews.text: It has been a great printer. The fan is a little louder than I was hoping, but it’s not bad for a laser printer. The quality is great & I’m so happy to be using toner rather than Ink cartridges. I do find the wireless printing a bit tricky - we have multiple routers and your computer have to be using the router that the printer is linked to. The user interface for syncing the printer with the router is rather annoying, and takes forever to enter all of the information. Those are mild complaints as the quality and price have been great. With multiple people using the printer for academic papers, it is definitely helpful to our budget.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer Brown

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't stay connected, not reliable
customer_reviews.text: I'm an IT professional and still can't get this printer to work correctly for me. It goes offline repeatedly, doesn't wake up when you send data to it, I have to reset the network settings repeatedly. If it's this frustrating for me, I can't imagine how frustrating it is for someone who doesn't have a technical background. I generally love Brother products, so I'm especially disappointed by how poorly this printer has performed so far.
customer_reviews.author: sabrina

customer_reviews.title: So far, so good! Can print wirelessly from iPhone. Prints cleanly even after long idle
customer_reviews.text: A friend sourced this for me and I bought it with birthday money. I've been nothing but happy with this color printer. I was able to link it to my wifi and print from my phone with very little trouble. Even better, it prints quickly on demand even if lots of time elapses between uses, unlike my experiences with inkjets. If you're looking to upgrade from inkjet for basic household printing tasks, I can recommend the Brother HL-3170CDW so you can stop looking. I have not yet tried it with photo paper or labels but it printed ok color pics on standard paper.
customer_reviews.author: Cranky Reader

customer_reviews.title: Brother printers very reliable
customer_reviews.text: This is my third Brother Color Laser printer. I have the 4570CDW and bought my mom one of these 3170CDW. They have both worked great with zero issues so when I needed another one for our weekend place, there was no decision to make, I purchased another 3170CDW and have been very satisfied with it. Initial toner isn't high capacity but like the fact that each toner color is separate so you only replace what you need.
customer_reviews.author: GlennWo

customer_reviews.title: Great Printer for a Great Price@
customer_reviews.text: It is a lot bigger than the monochrome Brother Laser printer that I had before, but once I go it set up in an appropriate spot, I fell in love! The color quality is far superior to my inkjet printers, so it is my new favorite for printing photos and other color documents! It is now my primary "go to" printer for just about everything in my small office. My Significant Other could not believe how little I paid for a color laser printer; he has been pricing them for years and had not even come close to the price I paid!
customer_reviews.author: blondeincharge

customer_reviews.title: Very poor toner lifespan....
customer_reviews.text: Im a poor college student and forked over more than I should have with this laser printer.. The toner only lasts about one ream. I cannot afford to fork over that much money for toner per ream.... just a bad deal. Other than that its a great printer, everything I could ask for, other that the horrible toner lifespan. If you're made of money this is the printer for you !
customer_reviews.author: Dr. Michele Stafford

customer_reviews.title: Chirp, Chirp, I did love it....
customer_reviews.text: Works seamlessly with my Macbook. Love the wireless networking so I can sit at my desk and print in another room. The only drawback is that the printer goes to sleep (saving energy) but when it wakes up there is a power surge that causes my fire detectors to chirp every time I activate the printer. No harm, no foul, apparently a lot of Laser printers do this but it took us several days to figure out. *update, printer fusion roller has deteriorated. I only printed 5,311 total pages in 19 months. Used 2 high capacity Cyan, Magenta and Yellow towner cartridges and three Black standard cartridges. Catastrophic failure and no response from Brother.
customer_reviews.author: Captain1818

customer_reviews.title: So far I LOVE IT!!
customer_reviews.text: I have a monochrome Brother duplexing printer that I've loved for about 4 years. I finally took the plunge into color and I am SO GLAD that I did!! It is so much easier (and more cost effective) to use a laser printer. I rarely (if ever) print photos and such. It is usually crafty things like little badge reels, fridge magnets, little education cards for work, etc. It works perfect and so far has a pretty clear result. I haven't utilized the higher resolution printing options, but I love it so far!!! Making my life so much easier!!
customer_reviews.author: CraftyNurseMomOfBoys&Dogs

customer_reviews.title: Printers have failed me twice now.
customer_reviews.text: While this machine worked, it was good. But I've had two of these printers go down with motor issues that weren't worth fixing. It saddens me because these machines are essentially disposable big hunks of metal and technology that I've had to send to "e-recyclers." I'm going to go with ink jet color printers
customer_reviews.author: D.K.

customer_reviews.title: but it is still annoying. I don't know if this is a printer ...
customer_reviews.text: Print quality is fantastic--photo quality prints on plain paper. I've only had this machine a month so haven't had to deal with replacing toner cartridges yet. My only complaint so far is that after a few hours of inactivity the machine goes into "deep sleep", and my Windows 8.1 PC sees it as "printer offline". The only fix for this that I have found is to remove and re-install the printer using the Windows Devices and Printers utility. This only takes about one minute, but it is still annoying. I don't know if this is a printer problem or a Windows problem, but it does not happen with my Brother HL-2280DW monochrome printer.
customer_reviews.author: Idaho Luke

customer_reviews.title: Great Printer
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this printer in 2016 as an HP inkjet replacement. 3 years later it is still going strong. The printer is fast, responsive, and great for home use. We only print moderately in the house so we are still on the first set of color toner cartridges. The black toner lasted us over a year. I would recommend this printer to anyone who would ask. Great product.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I'm very happy with this printer
customer_reviews.text: I'm very happy with this printer. i'm not a heavy printer user, i print a few pages occasionally but anytime i need to print the printer is ready and is printing wonderfully. i print from my phone, kindle, laptop, desktop - love the wireless capability of this thing! I would definitely recommend this for home use. I can't tell how well it performs under heavy use, how often the toner needs to be replaced etc.. - i haven't had to replace the toner yet (in almost 2 years i've owned it) for that you'll have to look at other reviews. But for occasional use this is great.
customer_reviews.author: MB72

customer_reviews.title: Works fine, good for the price range
customer_reviews.text: Driver is a bit tricky to install. Initially, I had problems. A fix on a Brother website Q&A page said to try changing some settings. This broke my spooler (win 7 pro). Deleting the printer from the registry got everything back (other printers, that is) and reinstalling worked (original problem no longer occurring). So, be careful. Also, the standard complaint: comes with extremely low-volume toner to start. Works fine. Quality is good, but obviously not as good as a $700 printer. Speed is good too.
customer_reviews.author: Clyde

customer_reviews.title: Didn't work with some products
customer_reviews.text: Looks sturdy and nice packaging. I was never able to connect wirelessly. I tried contacting brother and they didn't help, by the time I tried to return it I was a couple of days late because they only give you 30 days. Prints nicely of connected by cable tho
customer_reviews.author: Kristell Lee

customer_reviews.title: Most AWESOME printer form a guy that actually uses one daily!
customer_reviews.text: Bought in 2017. 2500+ pages printed. Time to say goodbye. Why? Heck, this printer is so cool for a color laser its time to upgrade! Going to go with Brother MFC-9330CDW. Why again? Let's add SCANNING 35 pages, FAX (not sure anybody does that anymore), And a COPIER!
customer_reviews.author: Termv

customer_reviews.title: Good printer for the price. Professional looking output.
customer_reviews.text: Awesome printer! My wife uses it for her small business and the quality is very good and professional looking. It replaces an aging Oki C3400 which needs four drums replace at $150 each! In the long run its cheaper to buy a new printer than the consumables for the old one... However, it doesn't have the same glossy toner that the Oki has. Blacks are blacker on the Oki, and color prints look like well, color pr ints, on the Oki. On this printer, blacks are matte and colors are dull. Good enough for documents but not for printing contact sheets or qualit artwork. Nonetheless, for the price, it is a winner.
customer_reviews.author: Hermann Pais

customer_reviews.title: Nice printer, but toner may get to be quite spendy.
customer_reviews.text: Very pleased with quality of printer, but many prints come out dark, even on special Hammermill color laser paper. Also surprised by 50 prints using up half the toner on all cartridges. I think a new set of cartridges is about $200, so that would make the toner cost about $2 per sheet. I was hoping to avoid that by going to toner from inkjet, but seems comparable to me. I was able to get about 25 13x19 prints from Epson 1280 with one set of cartridges, black and color, about $70 per set. Best to use the advanced setting to set the prints for lighter and more color.
customer_reviews.author: M. Jenner

product_meta.title: Brother HL-3170CDW Digital Color Printer with Wireless Networking and Duplex, Amazon Dash Replenishment Ready
product_meta.description: Style:HL-3170CDW| Pattern Name:PrinterThe HL-3170cdw is an affordable, fast, reliable Digital Color Printer for small businesses. It features automatic two-sided printing, wireless networking and prints high-impact color and crisp black documents at up to 23ppm. It's compact and offers versatile paper handling with a 250-sheet capacity letter/legal paper tray and a single-sheet manual feed slot for envelopes or thicker media. Models that are compatible with the latest Microsoft and Apple operating systems Windows 10 , Windows 8/8 x , Macintosh OSX 10.14 Mojave , Macintosh OSX 10.13 High Sierra
feature_bullets: Upon activation, the Amazon Dash Replenishment service measures the toner level and automatically orders toner from Amazon when low. This ensures that you never run out again.
Fast, high-quality printing at up to 23 ppm. No scanner or fax function.
Wireless and automatic two-sided printing. 18.3 x 16.1 x 9.4 inches.
High-impact business printing, at up to 600 x 2400 dp
250-sheet capacity paper tray, adjustable for letter or legal,Standard Interface(s):Wireless 802.11b/g/n, Ethernet, Hi-Speed USB 2.0
Class 1 Laser Product, power output is enclosed
NOTE: Refer the User Guide before use. Deep Sleep mode to conserve energy when printer is not being used (uses <1W)

specifications.Customer Reviews: 3.7 out of 5 stars2,000 ratings3.7 out of 5 stars
